triples.name: Overconfidence effect
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a new theory explaining overprecision as a specific manifestation of cognitive overconfidence resulting from neglecting all ways one could be wrong.

triples.name: Judgment and Decision Making
triples.relevance: The paper addresses how overprecision affects human judgment and decision-making across various domains.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper extends the theory of overprecision to artificially intelligent agents, explaining why overconfidence is ubiquitous among AI systems.

triples.name: Cognitive bias
triples.relevance: Overprecision is discussed as a cognitive bias where subjective certainty exceeds objective accuracy in judgments.
